It should be noted that, autolysis of yeast during fermentation might have released some aroma precursors such as amino acids, peptides, lipids, polysaccharides, nucleotides and nucleosides, which would in turn impact the aroma composition in obtained PKO after roasting, however, in our view, to a low extent
47â€“ 49 . It is known that autolysis usually occurs at the end of stationary growth phase when the fermentable carbon sources are almost depleted and is normally associated with cell death
47, 50 . In the current experiment, both amino acids and simple sugars were left with relatively high amount when fermentation was stopped, indicating that nutrients for yeast survive were available. According to the growth curve of Y. lipolitica in our preliminary experiment (data not shown), the stationary phase lasted at least for 4 days without obvious decrease in cell numbers. In the current study, fermentation was stopped at day 3 when the stationary phase was supposed to be ongoing.
